channel.title: Bosco Sodi on Artangled

item.title: Bosco Sodi - Heavens and the Earth | Blain Southern
item.description: There are two parts of this exhibition. First the heavens: big black and white paintings, made of ultra-thick paint, cracked in interesting ways, depicting mysterious swirls and bubbles. It’s as if you’re staring at a mountain range from the sky. Then the earth, brick towers in Jenga-style patterns. They look about as stable as Jenga towers, too: the bricks wonky and uneven. The bricks and the paint were both formed by chance as well as craft.
